summary: PHP SDK needs DTO comparison and alignment with Java/Go SDKs. Document differences in structure for ChildWorkflowOptions, RetryPolicy, WorkflowInfo, ActivityInfo and other data transfer objects, and identify missing fields like contextPropagators, cancellationType, and getRunStartedTimestampMillis().
userImpact: Inconsistent DTO structures between PHP and Java/Go SDKs make it harder for developers to work across multiple SDK languages and may cause integration issues.
rootCause: PHP SDK development proceeded independently without full alignment with Java/Go SDK DTOs, resulting in missing fields and structural differences.
proposedFix: Align PHP DTO definitions with Java/Go counterparts by adding missing fields like contextPropagators, cancellationType, getRunStartedTimestampMillis(), and ensuring consistent field naming and structure.
workaround: Binary checksum capability already exists in Version.php and needs to be exposed to Go SDK.
resolutionDetails: Issue tracked and addressed through DTO alignment efforts; missing fields identified and alignment with Java/Go SDKs completed.
keyQuote: Expose long getRunStartedTimestampMillis(), activity start to close and schedule to close timeout. Need to align DTO structures with Java and Go SDKs.
